Introduction

The Tru Vue Company is committed to operating in a manner that is safe for Tru Vue employees, the public, and the environment. As part of this commitment, Tru Vue has established a system to help ensure safe operation of the hydrofluoric glass etching process at this facility. One component of this program is called the risk management program (RMP) that helps control risks and complies with the requirements of the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) regulation 40 CFR part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Programs (The RMP Rule). One of the requirements of the RMP rule is to submit a risk management plan (RMP plan) describing the risk management program at Tru Vue. The plan is intended to satisfy the RMP plan requirements of the RMP Rule (68.150 through 68.185) and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at Tru Vue.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Policies

Tru Vue is committed to the safety of its employees and the public and to the preservation of the environment, through the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances. Tru Vue implements process controls to prevent foreseeable releases of hazardous substances. In the event of an accidental release, Tru Vue controls and contains the release in a manner that will be safe for it's employees and will cause the least degree of exposure and injury to the public or the environment.

Tru Vue Facility and Regulated Substances

The Tru Vue facility consists of production space and warehouse space for the production and shipping of value-added glass for the picture framing industry. Tru Vue receives thin sheets of glass in various s and will coat, etch, and/or wash each piece. Bulk shipments of 70% HF are received in 55-gallon barrels and are stored within containment inside the building. Tru Vue stores up to eight barrels at a time. 
HF acid, at the solution concentration of 50% or greater, is regulated

by the RMP Rule, and although HF of lesser concentration (about30%) is used in Tru Vue's process, HF acid at a solution concentration of 70% is stored in one large tank at the Tru Vue facility and is diluted in the process mixture.

A maximum of 440 gallons of 70% HF acid is stored in eight 55-gallon barrels located at the Tru Vue site. The weight of the HF acid in 440 gallons of 70% solution is 3,024 lbs. which exceeds the RMP threshold quantity for HF acid in a process (1,000 lb.). Tru Vue complies with the OSHA PSM rule and therefore is Program Level 3.

Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps
Tru Vue has engineered containment and neutralization systems to manage accidental releases of hydrofluoric acid.  Tru Vue also has a Spill Prevention, Control, and Countermeasure plan in place for the HF and have established relationships with the local fire department and chemical clean up crews in order to respond to accidental releases quickly and safely. 

Safety Information

Tru Vue maintains a Variety of technical documents that are used to help ensure safe operation of the glass etching process. Material Safety Data Sheets document the physical properties of the hazardous substances handled at Tru Vue, including HF Acid. The engineering design documents include design and operation parameters, applicable codes and standards, and configuration of the equipment in the covered process. 

Hazard Review

Tru Vue has completed a Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) using Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA) of the covered process. All hazards in the process were reviewed and the severity level, of the worst hazards, was reduced through changes to equipment and procedures. Tru Vue continues to work toward improvement of all hazards in the process.

Operating Procedures

Tru Vue develops and maintains operating procedures to define how tasks related to process operations should be performed. The operating procedures are used

to train employees and contractors and serve as reference guides for normal and emergency operation of the production line. Procedures continue to be updated as better methods and equipment become available.

Training

Tru Vue trains personnel in the operating procedures to help ensure safe and effective performance of their assigned tasks. A training documentation file is maintained to help ensure all employees are trained in procedures that pertain to their jobs and that refresher training is provided on a periodic basis.

Maintenance

Tru Vue properly maintains the process equipment in accordance with manufacturer's suggested procedures and Tru Vue's process requirements. The Tru Vue maintenance program includes procedures to safely guide workers in their maintenance tasks, worker training in the maintenance procedures, and a preventative maintenance program to help identify equipment deterioration and damage before the equipment fails.

Compliance Audits

Tru Vue performs regular compliance audits of the covered process to verify that the process is operating in compliance with the requirements of the RMP rule and within equipment specifications. 

Incident Investigations

Tru Vue investigates all incidents that could reasonably have resulted in an injury to personnel, the public, or the environment. Tru Vue encourages employees to identify and report any incident requiring investigation. An investigation team will be assembled, and the investigation will be initiated within 48 hours of the incident. The results of the investigation will be documented, recommendations will be resolved and appropriate process enhancements will be implemented.

HF Acid-Specific Prevention Steps

OSHA, Best Manufacturing Practices, and industry standards are followed at Tru Vue to help ensure safe handling of the 70% HF acid. The vendor supplies HF via a Department of Transportation (DOT) approved tank truck and follows DOT standards when offloading the 70% HF

acid. The storage tank design and construction are consistent with American Society of Mechanical Engineers standards. Workers who perform operations involving HF acid receive training emphasizing safe handling procedures for HF acid developed by Tru Vue.

Five-Year Accident History

Tru Vue maintains a five-year accident history that fulfills the requirements of the RMP rule (68.42). No releases of regulated substances have occurred from the Tru Vue facility in the last five years that have been of a reportable quantity.

Emergency Response Programs

Tru Vue has established a written emergency response plan that complies with the RMP rule and with other federal contingency plan regulations. The plan has been communicated to the local emergency response officials and a regular dialogue is maintained. Tru Vue has established a policy that will periodically conduct fire and evacuation drills, including annual drills coordinated with the local fire department.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Tru Vue constantly strives to improve the safety of the hydrofluoric etching line through the incident investigation program and audit program mandated in the RMP rule. Also, a program of safety meetings, which includes soliciting safety suggestions from all employees, is in place.

Tru Vue plans to continue to improve its standard operating procedures on an ongoing basis. Additional changes will be conducted as required to maintain a safe process. Tru Vue has been recognized by OSHA as a SHARP certified facility.
